intro: Coussarea surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam coussarea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and dense, evergreen foliage. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale yellow, with five petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests.
